voter_id_new.title: New Voter Registration
criteria: Must have reached the age of 18 by the date prescribed by the Election Commission.
Must have a permanent residence within the relevant Ward of a Municipality or Rural Municipality.
required_documents: Land Ownership Certificate (Lal Purja) or Educational Certificate (if address or age isn't clear on citizenship).
Passport or Driver's License (secondary evidence if requested).
Ward Office Recommendation (if other documents fail to prove residence).
process: Step 1: Visit the District Election Office or designated registration centers during the collection period.
Step 2: Provide personal details and have your photograph and fingerprints taken (biometrics).
Step 3: Verification of the details by the Registration Officer.
Step 4: Once the final list is published, you will be issued a Voter ID Card.

voter_id_lost_or_correction.title: Lost, Destroyed or Error Correction
voter_id_lost_or_correction.scenario_lost_destroyed: If the card is lost or destroyed, an application for a duplicate must be filed.
voter_id_lost_or_correction.scenario_correction: If there is an error in the name or details in the published list, the voter or a family member can apply to the Registration Officer to fix it.
required_documents: Application for a duplicate or correction.
Evidence supporting the claim (e.g., citizenship copy, police report for lost card).
process: Submit the application to the District Election Office.
The officer conducts an inquiry and submits it to the Chief Registration Officer for approval.

migration_or_marriage.desc: When moving due to marriage or relocation, you can transfer your name to the new location.
migration_or_marriage.requirement: Proof of marriage or a Migration Certificate (Basai Sarai) must be presented.

removal_of_name.desc: Names are removed in case of death, renunciation of citizenship, or double registration.
removal_of_name.process: Family members must notify the Registration Officer with proof of death or citizenship surrender.

temporary_voters.desc: Government employees, security forces, and prisoners can register in a 'Temporary Voter List' to vote in Proportional (PR) elections.
